intro: Calysericos parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered calysericos, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Calysericaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, small flowers. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
